vague_description: Determine the optimal allocation of small and large trucks for a snow removal crew with constraints on personnel, truck capacities, and neighborhood restrictions.
detailed_description: A snow removal company removes snow from neighborhoods using small trucks and large trucks. A small truck requires \param{PeopleSmallTruck} people to shovel the snow and can carry \param{CapacitySmallTruck} units of snow. A large truck requires \param{PeopleLargeTruck} people to shovel the snow and can carry \param{CapacityLargeTruck} units of snow. The company has available \param{TotalPeople} people. In addition, because some neighborhoods don’t allow big trucks, at least \param{MinSmallTrucks} trucks must be small. There must be at least \param{MinLargeTrucks} large trucks as well, and the number of small trucks must be \param{TruckProportion} times the number of large trucks. How many of each truck should be used to maximize the total amount of snow that can be transported?
target_objective: Maximize the total amount of snow transported by the company
target_constraints: Number of people assigned to small trucks is non-negative
Number of people assigned to large trucks is non-negative
The number of people for small and large trucks combined cannot exceed TotalPeople
At least MinSmallTrucks small trucks must be used
At least MinLargeTrucks large trucks must be used
target_parameters: Number of people required to shovel snow for a small truck
Capacity of snow that a small truck can carry
Number of people required to shovel snow for a large truck
Capacity of snow that a large truck can carry
Total number of people available for shoveling snow
Minimum number of small trucks required
Minimum number of large trucks required
Proportion of the number of small trucks to large trucks
